message.content:
cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CE, cs.EE

Reasoning: The paper focuses on bibliometric analysis of research related to environmental issues in unconventional oil and gas industry. Based on this, the most likely sub-category is cs.DL (Digital Libraries) as the study involves statistical analysis of publications and authors. The paper also involves analysis of collaborative relationships and emerging trends, which could fall under sub-categories such as cs.CY (Computational Geometry), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science). Additionally, the study involves analysis of energy and water consumption, which could fall under cs.EE (Electrical Engineering).
